item.title: Simulated Annealing without technical terms
item.description: (I had explained Simulated Annealing to someone on Udacity forum. Here was the conversation.) Can someone please explain simulated annealing to me with an example not using schedule(t) or Temperature? The video and book aren't too great at the explanation. Image Source: Wikipedia Let me give it a shot. If I have to explain it without using technical terms, I will describe it like this: Imagine that you are a dot on a 2D graph of maximas and minimas (peaks and valleys).

item.title: AI/ML Readings (living doc)
item.description: This is a (living) list of AI/ML Blogs that I visit. Personal Blogs Andrej Karpathy, also his blog at stanford. Colah’s Blog Denny Britz Company Blogs Google Research TasteHit - Full of intuitions and the big picture. Forums Reddit Machine Learning - Remain upto date with what’s happening in Machine Learning Reddit Artificial Intelligence - Same for AI
